alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Central and Southern Valley; Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:57AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Phillips, northeastern Petroleum, Garfield and southwestern Valley Counties through 300 AM MDT... At 157 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from U L Bend Rec Area to near Flowing Wells Rest Area. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glasgow, Jordan, The Pines Rec Area, Fourchette, U L Bend Rec Area, Duck Creek Rec Area, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Fort Peck Marina, Devils Creek Rec Area, Hell Creek Rec Area, Edwards, Brusett, Phillips, Van Norman, The Bentonite Plant, Steve Fork, Haxby, Content, and Sun Prairie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
